column1: Topic title: DAP Lim Lip Eng  100 JJPTR Investors Sought Help

column8: QIF45sblpAwAn MP claimed that he has been approached by about 100 JJPTR investors to help get their money back.DAP’s Segambut MP Lim Lip Eng said that the investors, from all over the world, had approached him in light of JJPTR recently claiming it lost RM500mil due to its accounts being hacked.Lim questioned JJPTR and its founder Johnson Lee on their refusal to lodge a police report on the theft.“It is a large sum of money. A police report should have been made,” he said at a press conference at his Segambut DAP Service Centre in Bandar Manjalara, Kuala Lumpur, yesterday.Lim, along with fellow politicians from DAP has formed a group called ZZJJPTR to help the victims of the Penang-based company.“JJPTR in Mandarin means to help the common folk, so we added ZZ at the front (short for Zen Zen) that roughly translates to really help the common folk,” he said.Bukit Aman Commercial Crime Investigation Department (CCID) director Comm Datuk Acryl Sani Abdullah Sani recently said police would begin investigations into the company following a police report made in Johor.http://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2017...eir-money-back/
